observations.statement: User experience is shaped by both administrative and regular user perspectives.
observations.quote: I had administrative credentials, if you will, privileges... that, frankly, colored my impression and my utilization of the website.

observations.statement: Users find the Wild Apricot application flexible and powerful for nonprofit needs.
observations.quote: I was impressed with wild apricot application in terms of what they were doing for nonprofit organizations like the newcomers.

observations.statement: The phone app is seen as underpowered and conflicting, causing frustration for users.
observations.quote: I rarely use the phone app, quite frankly, because I felt it was underpowered and gave conflicting information.

observations.statement: Clear communication about registration status is a significant issue.
observations.quote: I'm looking at the actual log here. And your registration expired because you didn't pay within the first 15 minutes.

observations.statement: Regular users rely heavily on the website for event information.
observations.quote: I found the news a hugely important source of information.

observations.statement: Users appreciate the ability to see who is attending events as a social connector.
observations.quote: I like the feature of being able to see who's actually already registered for events.

observations.statement: Event descriptions can lack clarity and transparency, leading to confusion.
observations.quote: Sometimes the event descriptions... were not as transparent or not as clear as they could be.

observations.statement: Users prioritize functionality over aesthetics when navigating websites.
observations.quote: I'm looking for utility... I want to do my business and I want to get out.

observations.statement: There is a lack of institutional memory due to frequent turnover in leadership.
observations.quote: The problem is the lack of a formalized institutional memory.

observations.statement: Training for new committee members is inadequate and needs improvement.
observations.quote: The training process really needs to have some hard, hard look at two issues.

observations.statement: The VP of activities should have prior experience with the system for effectiveness.
observations.quote: The requirement for the VP of activities absolutely has to be someone who has been a not only a co-chair.

observations.statement: Event management requires familiarity with the system, which new users lack.
observations.quote: The brand new person that's just getting going is really challenged by that.

observations.statement: Printed name tags are important for large events to verify registrations.
observations.quote: If I saw anyone walking around with a name tag... that was a clue that that person may not have been registered.

observations.statement: There is a need for a technical resource person to assist with event organization.
observations.quote: There ought to be a paid technical kind of person that really could be there, you know, as the glue to hold together all the aspects.

observations.statement: Users desire a more streamlined process for creating and managing events.
observations.quote: The mechanics of what I'm going to refer to as the back office work.

observations.statement: User feedback indicates that the website requires ongoing updates and improvements.
observations.quote: There are a couple of bumps in the road, of course, with everything.

observations.statement: Users are willing to pay for added value in services, such as alumni relations.
observations.quote: I'd be willing to pay 25 bucks a year for that privilege.

observations.statement: Users value the social aspect of events and networking opportunities.
observations.quote: I want to contact your friends and so forth and so on.

observations.statement: Event planning requires attention to detail, especially with cancellations and waitlists.
observations.quote: How do you manage a wait list? All of that is important.

observations.statement: Users experience a steep learning curve when transitioning into new roles.
observations.quote: The learning curve just hits the peak at the time of transition.

observations.statement: Frequent changes in leadership can hinder continuity and effective event planning.
observations.quote: Imagine running an organization, a corporation like that.

observations.statement: Users want a cleaner and simpler interface for better usability.
observations.quote: Cleaner, simpler, better is my approach.

observations.statement: Regular users often feel overwhelmed by the technical aspects of event management.
observations.quote: The mechanics of what I'm going to refer to as the back office work.

observations.statement: Users appreciate features that enhance the event experience, such as name tags.
observations.quote: I like the printed name tags as an audit function.

observations.statement: Users feel positive about the overall functionality of the website despite its flaws.
observations.quote: It's astounding to me that this thing works as well as it does.
